intro: Clibadium subsessilifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with warm, humid climates. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and are characterized by their pale yellow to white petals. The species is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
